annotation.TEXT: However, you'd better believe that there will be tougher Last Words coming up!
However, make sure you keep your distance from the boss, because after about 12 seconds...
You definitely want to take out the FOEs quickly, and they're going to arrive in more and more numbers as the spell goes on. As a bonus, you can get points (useless) and power (useful!) from them!

Actually, it looks like the tiny white bullets are following a pattern of some sort too, forming a sort of circle around the boss before going wherever, but they're more random-looking than the blue arrowheads.
Uh, oh! He's double flowering now! Still, don't panic. Just cross each set of bullets as they come to you.

Whoa! We've got this flower shaped design that'll probably take you completely by surprise if you're too close. It stops to rotate a bit before spreading out again, giving you time to dodge if you're far away.
When you're dodging bullets, always anticipate that any given bullet could bounce off the edge of the screen, so you don't get taken by surprise.
Then, there's this spiraling pattern that you've got to get through. I don't know if this one is technically aimed though. It could be.
A little bit of a close call there.
Honestly, this spell shouldn't be too bad if you can keep track of what's coming your way. But, be careful, or you might get cornered at a certain point!
Thankfully, you don't have to endure this intensity for the entire minute! Just the last 13 or so seconds.
Alright, so now we've got bullets that basically divide the field into quadrants, along with aimed balls that shoot aimed arrowhead shots.
I can dodge in between the yellow balls (like I showed on the first wave), but I just find it easier to do it this way.

I think this is the only Last Word in this game where your shot type matters, and I'm going to go with the right member of team Tetla Pot solo (the Yuyuko-like one), so I can get a little bit of a spread shot, even with no power.
Well, whatever the case, this spell shouldn't be too ridiculously hard anyway, and it's almost done.
Whoa! Go ahead and watch that again if you want! That had to have been a miracle that I didn't get hit there!
Ah, but we're not done yet! When there's about 13 seconds left, the quartets will become quintets!!!

Also, you'll certainly notice a ring of bullets form around you. These will stay around you, matching your movements. However, bullets near the bottom of the ring will shoot up suddenly, but they won't hit you as long as you don't make any large horizontal movements.
And you've gotta keep this up for a whole minute. Yeah, these spells are getting to be pretty much endurance matches.
At least this spell doesn't get faster over time like Murasa's does!
Kind of reminds me of Murasa's survival spell in a way.
This pattern will continue for the rest of the time limit. Stay in your quadrant and just keep sidestepping the aimed stuff.
Whoa, I made kind of a risky movement there! But, fortunately, I survived!

Almost done, but even after time runs out, there'll probably be a few lingering FOEs to watch out for. I don't know if getting hit by their attacks after time expires will prevent the spell from being considered a success, but I'd rather not chance it!
Try to move like I do here. From an upper-middle side of the field, move gradually downwards under the boss, then make a quick dash towards the other side, carefully dodging as you go.
Now, you may be thinking that, while those shot types may look formidable, there's this huge blind spot at the top of the screen. And yes, you can use that blind spot... for the first 15 seconds...
Now, this Last Word actually shouldn't be too difficult, but many of them are really tough, so don't be discouraged if you're having trouble with most of them.
Yeah, the last ten or so seconds of that spell was the trickiest part.

Hmm... Is it just me, or have I been dodging through the same repeating patterns of blue bullets here? Huh, I think the blue bullets are on a repeating pattern here. That's interesting, and it makes this spell slightly easier.
Alright, we've come all this way, and now it's time for the most difficult spell of them all in this game (at least to me)!
However, for the final four Last Words on the spell list, I'm sure they're unlocked by clearing Phantasm with each team (one unlock per team).
Alright, now we've arrived at the final four, which involve members of the playable teams. (Strangely, the Phantasm boss, Nearly Nothing, doesn't get a LW. I guess he's too much of a square...)

Ah, there we go, the quartets have arrived. Now it's getting really difficult to keep dodging them. It is possible to squeeze between the individual bullets of a group, and will probably eventually become necessary!
Aimed large black balls, which release a circular pattern of bullets that then spread out and you've got to make your way through. Sounds simple enough, but it gets tough fast.
If you weren't squeezing between the individual bullets of the groups before, you probably will be now!
This spell actually isn't that difficult if you pay attention for possible bounces, but staying alert for that for a whole minute could be a challenge.
It's still not too insane yet, but after about 20 or so seconds, the bullet triplets will become quartets!
It's the second boss, the eggplant dude! For this one, first of all, stay away from the bottom of the screen, because bullets will come from there.
To begin with, we've got some bullet sprays spiraling out from the boss. Just dodge through the openings. Shouldn't be too tough... yet.
Okay, fourth LW, which is coming from the stage 5 boss? Yeah, the stage 4 bosses get passed over on the LWs... for now.
Now this one could be tough. You've got waves of seven large yellow balls heading your way, with each one releasing a few green bullet spreads. Also, there's an aimed laser after each wave.
Alright, just three Last Words left!
After that, all of those patterns get repeated once, so dodge them again like before.
Like all other spells in this game's spell card practice, this is a survival spell, so you don't win by damaging the boss. Instead, you just gotta survive until time runs out.
Note that after you get through this spiral pattern the second time, a new pattern will start.
Okay, I think this is wave 10, so two more waves to go after this. I have failed on the 11th and 12th waves before. (I hate when I fail anything when I was so close to succeeding!)
Now for the fifth LW, which comes from the stage 6A boss.
That was cutting it kind of close there! Also, there's a couple tight squeezes you gotta get through at the very end here!
Done! Now, for the next Last Word, I'm going to change characters.
See y'all later!

Even if he doesn't place the flames all the way to the left, placing them close enough will make dodging the other bullets tougher, and pretty much require me to repeatedly squeeze through the individual bullets of the groups.
Fortunately, during a phase out, the purple bullets move in such a way that they give you a small amount of breathing room at the bottom before coming at you again.

Now, I don't think the waves get any faster or anything as the spell goes on, and after twelve waves, the timer will run out, so you can just count the waves as you go on this spell, instead of glancing up at the clock.
Hello, and welcome back to Project Nize Festival! I've decided to put together a video showing all of the Last Words in this game.
I'll be using team Clairvoyance for most of these. Now, Last Words are identified by the "LW" in front of their names in the spell list.

I like to tap dodge the aimed shots, and maybe occasionally switch which side of the screen I'm on. (There are red balls that'll always go down the center, but they're slow and spaced out enough to get past if you want to.)
Now, during this spell, the boss will continue to cycle through three different aimed patterns, while FOEs repeatedly drop in from above and fire aimed shots at you.
Also, the boss periodically fires out some larger shots horizontally, but you can pretty much ignore those. Instead focus on all the other stuff.
Now, the boss is periodically going to send out these flower patterns, so always stay far away. I usually stake out the lower corner that's farthest away from the boss.
Try not to let the second flower's appearance mess with your mind as you're dodging through the first flower.
Okay, now press right to access the next page of spells, and... Oh, there's the second LW right there!

Now, as for unlocking Last Words, I'm not 100% sure about the conditions for most of them. I think maybe by capturing certain spells belonging to the LW user in the normal game, perhaps their Last Spells, but I can't say for certain.
Um... Uh, oh! I really should've moved to the left there while I had the chance!
Final wave, and then time will run out.

Now, remember that other difficult Last Word from the Extra boss, that had bullet pairs, then triplets, quartets, and quintets? Now, we get to do that again, but while being attacked by Maribel Han's shot types as well!
As long as you keep your distance, this actually still isn't too bad.
Well, that's all of the Last Words! I hope you all enjoyed watching me show them off and capture them!
Now, for the sixth LW, we go straight to the Extra boss. Strangely, the stage 6B boss and the Extra midboss don't have LWs.
And, as per this guy's usual gimmick, we've got more phasing bullets! (At least it's not insanely fast and almost requiring quick movements like Reisen's Last Word!)
Okay, here's the first Last Word, used by the first boss.
It gets most difficult to dodge when the blue arrowheads are at the bottom of their circle. Just do your best to find a way through.
Now he's triple flowering?! Oh, man. Fortunately, time's just about up at this point, so you'll only have to get through one triple flower wave.
Alright, here's the third boss, and his Last Word is a bit tougher. You've got bullets scattering everywhere, with the blue arrowheads circling around him before going wherever they decide to go.
This one involves balls and arrowhead bullets, most of which will bounce off of the edges of the screen once. Also, some of the arrowheads are aimed at you.
Start off by dodging a few aimed strings of bullets, and then working your way through these spreads, which are also aimed at you.
Well, within a few seconds, those bullet pairs become bullet triplets, which definitely increases the difficulty. You can probably tell where this is going.

Sidestepping the laser should be simple enough. The real difficulty involves the other things. What I like to do is get the balls heading towards one corner, then race to the other corner, where I usually have an easier time dodging bullets.
But after that... Oh, boy. Yeah, definitely get away from the top of the screen before the timer passes 45!
Oh, and don't do something idiotic at the very end like moving close to him suddenly, or you might be taken out by a last-second flower. But, you're not that dumb, right?

Also, try to stay on the move, so you can dodge all of the aimed attacks. Don't try to slip in between the boss's three-way shots if you can help it, or else you might be trapped when the next aimed barrage comes your way.

And I'm going to be hoping that I don't get attacked by the boss at the wrong time, and praying that he stays near the opposite side of the screen for most of this. If the RNG decides to have him come over and place his "flames of doom" on the far left, I'm probably screwed, as escaping is nearly impossible!
Next up is Last Word number seven, coming from the Phantasm midboss.
It probably wouldn't have been difficult to add, and it would've made it more convenient for the player to be audibly informed when the timer is about to run out. Oh, well.
Also, note that he shoots out white bullets during a phase out that aren't affected by the phasing at all, giving you basically twice as many bullets to dodge at certain times!

So, yeah. Keep killing those FOEs and rushing up to the autocollect area to get power ups. Enough of them will appear to get your shot power above 1.00, and perhaps 2.00, which will help against future waves of FOEs.
This kind of reminds me of Koishi's "Danmaku Paranoia" in a way.

Of course, when I get to the quintets, I'll probably be squeezing through the groups anyway. Let's just hope I can survive the last few seconds without the boss blasting me at the wrong time, and without screwing up my dodging!
I suppose you could also try circling around above the boss as well, but I haven't tried that, so I don't know how effective that would be.
So, to get through this spell, just only make vertical movements along with tiny horizontal movements to dodge the blue bullets as necessary, and just keep this up for one minute.

Actually, that is one of the things that bothers me about Project Nize Festival. I kind of wish they put in the ding sounds for the last ten seconds of the timer like in I think every Windows Touhou game.

I had some close calls back there when I didn't follow my own advice. However, now I've passed 1.00 power, increasing my killing power! (Too bad that "Nullify" sign is kind of in the way of the "Power" display...)
Then just keep repeating these movements. Hopefully, these sort-of-U-shaped movement paths will allow you to get through the bullets when they're spread out enough to reasonably dodge.

Now I'm wondering if there's a potential exploit involving circling around the boss, which the horizontally moving larger shots are meant to guard against. Who knows? I always stay down here on this spell.

YES! YES! YEEESSS!!! Oh, my god! Capturing that the first time I think took me over 200 tries, and capturing it a second time for this recording took me well over another hundred tries! I am so glad that's over with!
Got it! That one took me a number of tries, but it's nowhere near the most difficult spell this game has to offer!
Whew! Captured the dang thing! That took me a few dozen tries at least. (Of course, maybe it's just me. Maybe some other people would find that spell quite easy somehow.)
Only a few seconds left. Don't screw up now! (Of course I won't screw up. I didn't include any failed attempts in this video!)
And of course, with the boss attacking me as well, I can't just maneuver around those other bullets in the middle of the field, so I'm going to be near the side of the screen for most of this.

Alright, that's two down. Now let's move on to number three. Also, you might notice that often when I start a spell here, you'll see a still gameplay image briefly before it actually begins. That seems to be a leftover image from my previous run, which lingers around for a second after I select a spell for some reason.
There we go! Now, on to the next one! (Oh, by the way, you're going to see a transition effect between each spell in this video. I recorded each one separately, and put them together in WMM.)
We're facing off against... Nitehinarumono Hinanjo? Well, despite the different name, that's clearly a member of team Maribel Han, using Maribel Han's shot types!
Now, this is one of the most difficult Last Words (at least for me). It starts off with spreads of bullet pairs coming from both upper corners of the field. Doesn't seem too insane yet, right?
First, he opens with basic lines that are child's play to graze, but then we're getting spiral patterns after that. This could get really complicated quick!
